result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando L. Wilson

records.addlTxt:
1:34 PM  Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Orlando L. Wilson in court, in custody.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Orlando L. Wilson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Both parties are ready to proceed to trial on Monday. Ludwig hearing held. Court discusses offer with the DE; DE rejects the State's offer on the record. This matter is the #1 trial set for Monday, November 7th, 2022. ADA Lehman advises the Court that he just received some photo discovery and provided copies to Attorney Solis before court this afternoon. ADA Lehman and Attorney Solis both believe they have all the discovery.

01:49 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Orlando L. Wilson, appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Solis orally makes a speedy trial demand and is requesting a trial date be scheduled. Attorney Solis given scheduling conference order in court today.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Drew Lehman in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Xavier Solis in court with Defendant Orlando L. Wilson who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT
      Sworn in and testified is State's witness:  Detective Alberto Gonzales; cross-examination by Atty Lehman State rests and moves for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Felicia L, Javon H, Jerome H.

01:25 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.   $1,000   Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
